Name: ITP - Electrical Cable Trenching & Installation
Preconstruction
Design Drawings
Issued for Construction Drawings available
Site Preparation
Visual inspection of cleared and levelled area
Site free from debris, vegetation, and unevenness
Survey and Marking
Alignment with approved IFC drawings & Digital Designs
Material Approval
Bedding and backfill sand complies with the specification notes for thermal resistivity
Finger Trenching - Trench Excavation
Trench Excavation
Finger trenches excavated to a minimum of 900 deep x 250mm wide
Finger trench invert is smooth without stones or rocks protruding
Finger Trenching - Trench Bedding
Finger trench bedding consists of a minimum of 100mm of sand
Finger Trenching - Cable Installation
Cables installed in accordance with the IFC Drawings and specifications
Finger Trenching - Trench Backfill
Finger trenches shall include 75mm of sand over the cables
Hard protection shall be installed over the previous layer of sand to cover the full width and extent of cables
75mm of sand has been placed over the hard protective cover
Earth cables have been installed on the final layer of sand
Soft warning tape is placed over the full extent of the cables in the trench at a maximum of 400mm below the existing ground surface
Existing excavated material is replaced and lightly compacted
Finger Trenching - Reinstatement
Finger trenches are reinstated back to tie into existing ground levels and contours
Combined Services/DC Trenches - Trench Excavation
Combined Services trenches are excavated to a minimum of 900 deep and wide enough to accommodate all of the cables required including minimum separation distances
Trench inverts are smooth without stones or rocks protruding
Combined Services/DC Trenches - Trench Bedding
Combined Services trenches bedding consists of a minimum of 100mm of sand
Combined Services/DC Trenches - Cable Installation
Cables installed in accordance with the IFC Drawings and specifications
Minimum separation distances are observed
Combined Services/DC Trenches - Trench Backfill
Combined Services trenches shall include 75mm of sand over the cables
Hard protection shall be installed over the previous layer of sand to cover the full width and extent of cables
75mm of sand has been placed over the hard protective cover
Earth cables and comms ducts have been installed on the final layer of sand
Soft warning tape is placed over the full extent of the cables in the trench at a maximum of 400mm below the existing ground surface
Existing excavated material is replaced and lightly compacted
Combined Services/DC Trenches - Reinstatement
Combined Services trenches are reinstated back to tie into existing ground levels and contours
Comms & LV Trenches - Trench Excavation
Comms/LV trenches are excavated to a minimum of 800 deep and 250mm wide
Trench inverts are smooth without stones or rocks protruding
Comms & LV Trenches - Trench Bedding
Comms/LV trenches do not require bedding due to the cables being installed in conduit, but if rock is encountered, a minimum layer of 100mm of sand shall be placed
Comms & LV Trenches - Cable Installation
Cables installed in accordance with the IFC Drawings and specifications
Minimum separation distances are observed
Cables have been installed in conduit
Comms & LV Trenches - Pull Pit Installation
Pulling Pits are installed on a 100mm of Gap20 bedding
Pulling pits are installed on the line of the conduits
The tops of the pulling pits and level and clear of the road lane
Comms & LV Trenches - Trench Backfill
Comms/LV trenches shall be completely backfilled with excavated trench material
Hard protection shall be installed over 75mm of backfill above the conduits
Soft warning tape is placed over the full extent of the conduits in the trench at a maximum of 400mm below the existing ground surface
Comms & LV Trenches - Reinstatement
Comms/LV trenches are reinstated back to tie into existing ground levels and contours
33kV AC Trenches - Trench Excavation
AC trenches are excavated to a minimum of 1200 deep and wide enough to accommodate the three cables laid in a trefoil arrangement
Trench inverts are smooth without stones or rocks protruding
33kV AC Trenches - Trench Bedding
AC trenches bedding consists of a minimum of 100mm of sand
33kV AC Trenches - Cable Installation
Cables installed in accordance with the IFC Drawings and specifications
Minimum separation distances are observed of 1200mm to any other cable
Cables to be installed with minimum of 1200mm cover
33kV AC Trenches - Trench Backfill
AC trenches shall include 75mm of sand over the cables
Hard protection shall be installed over the previous layer of sand to cover the full width and extent of cables
75mm of sand has been placed over the hard protective cover
Soft warning tape is placed over the full extent of the cables in the trench at a maximum of 400mm below the existing ground surface
Existing excavated material is replaced and lightly compacted
33kV AC Trenches - Reinstatement
AC trenches are reinstated back to tie into existing ground levels and contours
Road Crossings - Trench Excavation
Road crossing trenches are  excavated to minimum widths and depths as described in the cross sections of the Electrical Drawings
Minimum cover shall be:
AC Cables - 1200mm
DC Cables - 800mm
Auxiliary/comms/lighting - 600mm
Trench inverts are smooth without stones or rocks protruding
Road Crossings - Trench Bedding
Trench bedding consists of a minimum of 100mm of sand
Road Crossings - Cable Installation
Cables installed in accordance with the IFC Drawings and specifications in 100mm HD Conduits - AC cables to be in 150mm conduits
Minimum separation distances are observed:
DC Cables - 300mm
more than 24 DC Cables a gap of 150mm in the middle
Earth cables - 150mm
Road Crossings - Trench Backfill
Road Crossings trenches shall include 150mm of sand over the conduit
Hard protection shall be installed over the previous layer of sand to cover the full width and extent of cables
Soft warning tape is placed over the full extent of the cables in the trench at a maximum of 400mm below the existing ground surface
Backfilled material shall excavated trench material backfilled and compacted to 95% native soil density
Existing excavated material is replaced and lightly compacted
Road Crossings - Reinstatement
AC trenches are reinstated back to tie into existing ground levels and contours
Post Construction and Handover - Final Walkthrough & Inspection
Final Walkthrough & Inspection
Comprehensive inspection of all elements relating to the Electrical Trenches
Compliance with IFC drawings and specifications
Verify all Drainage meets design and functional requirements
United Civil & CHINT Hold Point
Post Construction and Handover - Non-Conformance-Reports
Each Non-Conformance Reported, Rectified & Closed Out
Post Construction and Handover - Punch List
Development of Punchlist with Client and Contractor Representative
Punch List closed out in a timely mannor

Documentation
